title: If we can't travel at the speed of light, can we travel close to its speed? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Einstein showed that there is a Universal Speed Limit. There are some nice Thought Experiments that prove it (either that or other strange things are happening). Distance contraction and time dilation aside, anything that gets near the speed of light will become MASSIVE, so MASSIVE that you cannot push it anywhere (i.e. it gets infinite inertia).
